name: Prenzlauer Berg close to Mauerpark
space: In the summertime we are spending most of our weekends in our little house in our garden and want to use the opportunity to rent a room in our cosy 2 bedroom apartment. But we might also stay in the other room. We will be very happy to give you tips on things to do and see in Berlin and make sure your stay runs smoothly. The room is about 25 square meters and is located on the 2nd floor. The bed measures 180 cm x 200 cm and is fitted with a kapok futon, which is a hard-ish mattress but which we find very pleasant to sleep on. The bakery next door is open everyday from up 7 am, which makes warm croissants for breakfast very tempting. On Sundays don't miss the traditional flea markets on Arkonaplatz and in the nearby Mauerpark for special treats and souvenirs.  check out our  travel guide and please let us know what your highlights were so we can add them for future guests

access: I do have a strictly non-smoker-flat.  Keep the room really clean and tidy. I had some not so nice experiences in the last time. And I have to ask you to keep also the common german house-rules like no noise after 8:00 PM / 20:00 hrs.  Please do not disturb the neighbours, specially in the evening and night. As I am a "green" person I have to ask you not to waste energy, water and paper. I think also following generations will need the sources and enjoy the wood.
interaction: I'm working as a freelancing photographer. My main topic is Berlin, its  architectur, people, and art. Usually I am informed what on in the very moment.   But I work also on travels for reportage. In former years I was working as TV-journalist, web-content-editor, designer of graphics, exhibitions, websites and audio-vision.   I have to work at home, because I'm handicaped in the moment due to a botched surgery when I've got a new artificial knee. Therefor I am not able to walk properly - specially steps. In the flat it's ok now and outside I still need my wheelchair.  So if you like to help me from time to time to take down trashbags this would be a great help for me.  I am very thankful for your understanding. I love Berlin, it's many varieties of culture, and can tell you a lot about it.  I also travelled a lot and have high interest in world-culture and world-music, besides of R&B, classic and moderate Jazz. There are a lot of things to do in Berlin, which I appreciate very much.

Also at a stone's throw away is an old (but renovated) brewery area with Clubs, Theater and Cinema. In every street is more than one "Späti" the famous late night stores for food, tobacco, drinks and more.. If you have children you will be amazed about the many playgrounds!

I expect that in return! A few house-rules: 1. Take off the shoes in the apartment. Use your slippers! 2. Don't host other guests without my prior approval. 3. Please turn off any light that you are not using. 4. Use water responsibly, don't waste it arbitrary. 5. Please put the heating down when you leave the apartment during the day. 6. Please ensure regular and adequate room aeration. 7. This is a non-smoking apartment. 8. Volume: Since the apartment is in a normal residential house and in the interests of good neighborly relations, I ask you to adjust the volume in the evenings/nights accordingly. Loud parties are not allowed! THANK YOU VERY MUCH!
host_about:
I'm a creative person, adventurer, and traveler and always looking forward to my next trip! I love beaches, palm trees and out of the way places. 
Morocco, Portugal and Spain have become my favorite destinations and I prefer staying with local people so I really have a chance to learn about the area I am visiting. 
I am easy going and love making new friends! I love Yoga and fitness. I enjoy mindful and easy conversation and like to stretch a point.
I speak English, a little Spanish and a little French but found that communication is never a big problem as long as you trust in speaking gestures.
As one of the most experienced Airbnb Superhosts in Berlin I know how to be a mindful guest.
When I am at home and slip into the role of a host I am looking forward to welcoming you in my guestroom here in Prenzlauer Berg.

neighborhood_overview: Description: A stone's throw away you'll find the Viktoria-Park, for Berlin people known as the "Kreuzberg", with a lovely waterfall. An oasis of relaxation with a very nice and large children's playground next to a little Biergarten (Golgatha) and a high monument from where - weather permitting - you can enjoy a spectacular view over the city. The Bergmannstraße with it's many cafés, bars, restaurants, second hand shops is just a couple of walking minutes away. There are wine dealers, supermarkets, pharmacies and one of the three last remaining historical market halls in Berlin. South of Bergmannstraße in the small side streets (Chamisso Platz) you'll think you've gone back to centuries past: Cobblestone streets and Wilhelminian style tenements with stucco decorations. The closest supermarkets are Kaisers (corner Großbeerenstraße), ALDI, Lidl  and Getränke Hoffmann on the western end of Kreuzbergstraße. The Kaiser´s supermarket in Bergmannstraße is even open until midnight (mon-sat).

host_about: I live and work in Windhoek, Namibia. I am a part-time Yoga Instructor. I enjoy travelling to exotic destinations when time permits. My all time favourite book: The Hobbit - must read. I have chosen Berlin because it is vibrant, full of energy, very individual, still embrace a rather hedonistic approach to life considering it is one of the main capital cities of Europe. The sub-culture, the art-scene- poor but sexy, a village feel yet with all the fantastic facilities that a city can offer. Most of all, Berlin changes its face with every moving second, yet, Berlin remains Berlin deep at heart. Where better place than the heart of the former Eastern Part of Berlin, Prenslauerberg? East West fusion manifests itself when you least expect. Mostly subtle but from time to time, as plain as the nose on one's face. The sub-culture is usually only perceivable after a fair stay in Berlin.

neighborhood_overview: Prenzlauer Berg is no doubt one of the most mythical districts of the city. It embodies Berlin’s cultural heritage from diverse historical periods, proletarian and middle-class styles of the fin-de-siècle, just as the imprint of socialism. What is more, there has always been a tradition of resistance and opposition giving birth to the spirit of creativity that incessantly surrounds you here. neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the trendy, vibrant district of Prenzlauer Berg, bordering on artistic, cosmopolitan Mitte. The Oderberger Strasse is a very lively yet very relaxed street that offers the distinctively bohemian vibe Prenzlauer Berg has been made famous for. Artsy cafés, quaint boutiques and laid back restaurants make it a favourite destination of locals and visitors alike.  Neighbourhood highlights include the Kastanienallee with its dozens of bars, restaurants and coffee shops -among which the renowned Prater, Berlin’s oldest beer garden- and the Mauerpark with its very popular Sunday flea market. The entertainment complex of the Kulturbrauerei is just around the corner, as well as the Kollwitzplatz with its fine wining and dining (and, of course, shopping). The not-to-be-missed Berlin Wall Memorial is in the vicinity of the apartments whereas Berlin landmarks such as the TV Tower or the Museum Island are a leisurely stroll. name: Riverside View Apartment
summary: Sunny room in 2 room apartment, fantastic view on the canal, park across the street, Cafés and bars close by. House on the former wall between Neukölln, Kreuzberg and Treptow.
space: One room in a spacious, sunny luxury two-room apartment available in Berlin Treptow/Kreuzberg, plus kitchen, bathroom and balcony.  I only sublet one room of about 35 qm. This apartment - on the 4th floor (with lift) of a recently (2000) built house - has panoramic windows with a phantastic view over the Landwehrkanal and Kreuzberg/Neukölln. It is located across the street from Landwehrkanal and Görlitzer Park. Cafés, bars and restaurants (Schlesische Str, Reuterkiez, "Kreuzkölln") close by. Bathroom with full tub and seperate shower. Possible use of TV, DVD player, wireless internet connection.  Price per night 40€, per week 260€. Cleaning fee 20€.

neighborhood_overview: Berlin-Fiedrichshain is a friendly and vibrant district for families, couples and singles. There are lots of little shops, cafes, restaurants just around the corner. At weekends there is a market and fleemarket at Boxhagener Platz (5 min walk). You also find nice parks for sport-activities, some cinemas and clubs (Berghain, Suicide Circus, Watergate, Süß war gestern, Kater Blau, Wilde Renate etc.) in that area. Berlin-Mitte with its museums is the next district and just 20 min away by public transport.
